description: This error occurs when the server cannot be reached.
solution: Check if the server is running and reachable.
causes: The server is down or not started.
Firewall or network configuration blocking the connection.
examples: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: no further information
troubleshooting: Ensure the server is running and reachable.
Check firewall and port forwarding settings.
Verify the server IP and port in the client configuration.

description: The plugin '${plugin}' failed to load due to compatibility or configuration issues.
solution: Ensure the plugin '${plugin}' is compatible with your Minecraft version.
causes: Plugin version is outdated or incompatible.
Missing dependencies required by the plugin.
troubleshooting: Update the plugin to the latest version.
Check if all required dependencies are installed.
Re-download the plugin files and verify their integrity.

description: The ItemLocksFabric ItemLock is purely client-side and does not work on servers.
solution: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
causes: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
troubleshooting: Itemlock mod is client-side only and does not work on servers.
Remove from your server mods folder

description: The server has run out of memory.
solution: Upgrade the server's RAM or reduce the number of plugins or mods.
causes: High server load due to concurrent logins
Slow network response from the client
troubleshooting: Server: out of memory = true, you should upgrade your server's RAM, or reduce the number of plugins or mods.
Client-Side: In your modloader client, you can increase the amount of memory allocated to the game.

description: An incompatible class cast was attempted.
solution: Check for plugin/mod compatibility or update your Java version.

description: A required file is missing or corrupted.
solution: Verify your modpack or server files.

description: A recursive loop in your code or a plugin caused this error.
solution: Disable recent changes or plugins to debug.

pattern: java\.util\.zip\.ZipException: error in opening zip file
description: A mod or plugin file is corrupted.
solution: Re-download and replace the affected mod/plugin.

description: The server crashed due to a mod, plugin, or configuration error.
solution: Check logs and recent changes for the issue.

description: A plugin or mod accessed an invalid object.
solution: Update or remove the problematic plugin/mod.

description: A required mod is missing.
solution: Install all required mod dependencies.

description: Network issues are causing timeouts.
solution: Check the server's network configuration or player's internet connection.

description: The port the server needs is already in use.
solution: Ensure no other server or application is using the same port.

description: The server version is outdated compared to the client.
solution: Update the server to match the client version.

description: The client version is outdated compared to the server.
solution: Update the client to match the server version.

pattern: You need to agree to the EULA
description: The EULA agreement has not been accepted.
solution: Set 'eula=true' in the 'eula.txt' file after reviewing it.
causes: High server load due to concurrent logins
Slow network response from the client
troubleshooting: Ensure you accept the EULA agreement by setting 'eula=true' in the 'eula.txt' file.
If no file name eula.txt is found, create a new text file named eula.txt and add eula=true to the file, ans save it.

pattern: This crash report has been saved to:
description: The server generated a crash report.
solution: Check the crash report file for details.
causes: When a server Crash Report is generated, it is saved to the server's crash-reports folder. The file name will be in the format 'crash-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS-server.txt'.
examples: // I just don't know what went wrong :(
Description: Exception in server tick loop
java.lang.NullPointerException: Exception in server tick loop
troubleshooting: When a server Crash Report is generated, it is saved to the server's crash-reports folder. The file name will be in the format 'crash-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS-server.txt'.

description: Mojang authentication servers may be down, or server settings need adjustment.
solution: Check the server.properties file and Mojang status.

description: A problematic entity caused the crash.
solution: Use MCEdit or similar tools to remove the entity.

description: Java version and build date detected.
solution: Ensure the required Java version matches the server or modpack requirements.

pattern: Distant Horizons.*encountered an error during the sided_setup event phase
description: Error with the Distant Horizons mod during the sided setup event phase. The error occurs because a configGui instance is null, causing a NullPointerException. This results in a server startup failure.
solution: Ensure the Distant Horizons mod version is compatible with the server/forge version. Verify if the Distant Horizons mod requires additional libraries or dependencies not included in your modpack. Remove this mod to see if your server will boot.

description: Multiple warnings indicate that Wilder Nature entity types (e.g., wildernature:raccoon) were not realized during the registry phase.
solution: Verify that the Wilder Nature mod is compatible with the current Forge and Minecraft versions. Ensure all dependencies for the Wilder Nature mod are present and up to date. Reset the mod’s configuration files in the config/ directory to their defaults. Temporarily disable other mods to test if conflicts prevent Wilder Nature from loading entities properly. Check for updates to Wilder Nature addressing this issue. Report this issue on the mod's support page or issue tracker.

pattern: java\.lang\.Error: ServerHangWatchdog detected that a single server tick took \d+\.\d+ seconds.*
description: The server detected a hang, where a single server tick took significantly longer than the expected maximum of 0.05 seconds. This indicates minor server lag.
solution: You can turn off watchdog by going to - YourServerFolder/server.properties - max-tick-time=-1 - Default is 60000

pattern: Server is still starting! Please wait before reconnecting\.
description: A player attempted to connect while the server was still starting.
solution: Inform players to wait for the server to fully start before reconnecting.

description: The server is preparing the spawn area.
solution: This is normal during server startup and does not require action.

pattern: A new sound was added after the sounds were registered and therefore the new sound could not be added!
description: Chance Cubes mod failed to register a new sound after the sound registration phase.
solution: Verify that the Chance Cubes mod is compatible with the current version of Minecraft/Forge.

pattern: Couldn't fully analyze .* free_runners_armored.*missing knowledge for \{.*\}
description: The Immersive Engineering mod encountered an incomplete analysis for free_runners_armored.
solution: Ensure all dependencies for Immersive Engineering are installed and compatible. If the issue persists, report it to the mod developers.

pattern: Could not serialize .*\(class .*\) - will not be sent to client!
description: A mod or plugin failed to serialize a custom argument type, causing communication issues with the client.
solution: Check the logs for details about the specific mod or plugin causing the issue. Ensure it is compatible with the current Minecraft/Forge version.

description: A block entity caused the server to crash.
solution: Use a tool like MCEdit to locate and remove the problematic block entity. Check mod compatibility and update all mods to their latest versions.

description: A mod (e.g., Mekanism) encountered an invalid stack for a specific inventory slot.
solution: Ensure the mod causing the issue is up-to-date and compatible with the Minecraft/Forge version. Reset the affected block or entity.
causes: Corrupted item data in the player's inventory.
Mod conflict causing invalid item registration.
Server desynchronization with client inventory data

description: A mod ('${mod}') encountered an invalid stack for a specific inventory slot.
solution: Ensure the mod '${mod}' is up-to-date and compatible with the Minecraft/Forge version. Reset the affected block or entity.

pattern: com\.google\.gson\.JsonSyntaxException: Expected name to be an item, was unknown string '(?<mod>[a-zA-Z0-9_:-]+)'
description: A loot table contains an invalid or unknown item in the mod: ${mod}.
solution: Verify the loot table configuration for ${mod}. Ensure the specified items exist and are correctly registered.

description: The block referenced in the loot table is missing in the mod: ${mod}.
solution: Check if the block exists in the ${mod} mod or verify that the mod version is correct.

description: Loot table parsing failed for a block in the mod: ${mod}.
solution: Verify the loot table syntax in the ${mod} mod. Ensure the items, blocks, and properties referenced exist.

description: A concurrency task encountered an error, possibly due to high server load.
solution: Reduce the server load or check for problematic tasks in mods or plugins. Consider optimizing server performance.

description: A loot table in the KubeJS mod failed to apply.
solution: Check the KubeJS scripts for syntax or logical errors related to loot tables.

pattern: \[.*?ERROR\]: Username '(.*?)' tried to join with an invalid session
description: A player attempted to join with an invalid session.
solution: The session for the player '${1}' is invalid. Ask the player to log out of their Minecraft client and log back in to refresh their session.

description: The mod '${mod}' processed login for user '${username}' which took ${time}ms.
solution: Optimize ${mod} performance by reviewing server load and connection times.
causes: High server load due to concurrent logins
Slow network response from the client
troubleshooting: When you try to join a Fabric server through BungeeCord/Waterfall using FabricProxy, LuckPerms does not allow that login because player's data couldn't be loaded during the pre-login stage.
Check server TPS and reduce load, you can test the tps by typing /tps or /forge tps

description: The ItemLocksFabric ItemLock is purely client-side and does not work on servers.
solution: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
causes: Remove the ItemLocksFabric, ItemLock Mod from your server Mods folder.
troubleshooting: Itemlock mod is client-side only and does not work on servers.
Remove from your server mods folder

pattern: java\.lang\.RuntimeException: Tried to read NBT tag with too high complexity, depth > [0-9]+
description: A corrupted or excessively nested NBT structure is causing the save file or world data to be unreadable.
solution: Use an NBT editor (e.g., NBTExplorer) to identify and remove the problematic NBT data. Restore the world from a backup if available.
causes: A mod stored infinitely nested or malformed NBT data.
Corrupted world data due to a crash or forced shutdown.
Incompatible mods writing invalid NBT entries.
examples: java.lang.RuntimeException: Tried to read NBT tag with too high complexity, depth > 512
troubleshooting: Open the world files with NBTExplorer to locate and fix the offending data.
Temporarily remove recently added mods to isolate which one created the invalid data.
Restore from a known good backup of the world.

pattern: Can't keep up! Is the server overloaded\? Running [0-9]+ms or [0-9]+ ticks behind
description: The server is experiencing lag and cannot process ticks at the expected rate.
solution: Optimize server performance by allocating more RAM, reducing the number of mods/plugins, or upgrading hardware.
causes: Too many entities, mods, or complex redstone contraptions.
Heavy chunk loading or world generation.
examples: Can't keep up! Is the server overloaded? Running 2199ms or 43 ticks behind
troubleshooting: Allocate more RAM to the server.
Remove or limit heavy mods and resource-intensive builds.

pattern: defineId called for: class net\.minecraft\.world\.entity\.TamableAnimal from interface dev\.muon\.medievalorigins\.entity\.IFollowingSummon
description: A mod-related warning indicating data ID definition for a tamable animal entity that follows a summon interface.
solution: Check if the Medieval Origins mod is up-to-date and compatible with the current Minecraft/Forge version. This is generally a harmless warning.
causes: The mod 'Medieval Origins' or a related entity mod may be registering entities in an unusual way.
examples: defineId called for: class net.minecraft.world.entity.TamableAnimal from interface dev.muon.medievalorigins.entity.IFollowingSummon
troubleshooting: Update or verify the Medieval Origins mod version.
Check the mod's issue tracker for similar warnings.

description: Detected Java version.
solution: Ensure the Java version matches the server or modpack requirements.

description: Detected Minecraft version from logs.
solution: Ensure mods are compatible with this version.

description: A required mod, (${missing_mod}), is missing from the server configuration.
solution: Ensure the mod (${missing_mod}) is installed and loaded.
causes: The required mod is not present in the `mods/` folder.
The mod version is incompatible with the server version.
examples: [ERROR]: Missing required mod: Just Enough Items (JEI)
troubleshooting: Check the `mods/` folder to ensure the mod is installed.
Ensure the mod version is compatible with the server and other mods.
Download the missing mod from a trusted source (e.g., CurseForge).
